'''Nermir''' were the [[fays]] of the meads (meadows),<ref group=note>In the ''[[Gnomish Lexicon]]'', they were the fays that haunted meadows ''and'' riverbanks, instead.</ref><ref name=Ndr/> according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''.<ref>{{LT1|Appendix}}, entry '''Nermir''', p. 262</ref><ref>{{PE|14}}, "[[The Creatures of the Earth]]", p. 10</ref>

They arrived to the world with [[Aulë]] and [[Yavanna]], along with many other types of fays.<ref>{{LT1|III}}, p. 66</ref>

== Etymology ==
The name ''Nermir'' is in [[Qenya]], likely being the plural form of ''nermi'' ("a field-spirit");<ref name=Ner/> the [[Gnomish]] cognate of ''nermi'' was '''''nermil'''''.<ref name=Ndr>{{PE|11}}, entry '''nermil''', p. 60</ref>

The word ''nermi'' is derived from the root [[NESE]] ("give to feed; feed, pasture; graze").<ref name=Ner>{{PE|12}}, entry '''NESE'''-, p. 66</ref>
